description: Returns Amazon Web Services resource descriptions for running and deleted stacks. If StackName is specified, all the associated resources that are part of the stack are returned. If PhysicalResourceId is specified, the associated resources of the stack that the resource belongs to are returned. For deleted stacks, DescribeStackResources returns resource information for up to 90 days after the stack has been deleted. You must specify either StackName or PhysicalResourceId, but not both. In addition, you can specify LogicalResourceId to filter the returned result. For more information about resources, the LogicalResourceId and PhysicalResourceId, see the CloudFormation User Guide.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack, which aren't always interchangeable: Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID. Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID. Required: Conditional. If you don't specify StackName, you must specify PhysicalResourceId.

parameters.name: PhysicalResourceId
parameters.description: The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource supported by CloudFormation. For example, for an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instance, PhysicalResourceId corresponds to the InstanceId. You can pass the EC2 InstanceId to DescribeStackResources to find which stack the instance belongs to and what other resources are part of the stack. Required: Conditional. If you don't specify PhysicalResourceId, you must specify StackName.

nested_items.name: StackResources
nested_items.description: A list of StackResource structures.

nested_items.name: StackName
nested_items.description: The name associated with the stack.

nested_items.name: StackId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier of the stack.

nested_items.name: LogicalResourceId
nested_items.description: The logical name of the resource specified in the template.

nested_items.name: PhysicalResourceId
nested_items.description: The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource supported by CloudFormation.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: Type of resource. For more information, see Amazon Web Services resource and property types reference in the CloudFormation User Guide.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: Time the status was updated.

nested_items.name: ResourceStatus
nested_items.description: Current status of the resource.

nested_items.name: ResourceStatusReason
nested_items.description: Success/failure message associated with the resource.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: User defined description associated with the resource.

nested_items.name: DriftInformation
nested_items.description: Information about whether the resource's actual configuration differs, or has drifted, from its expected configuration, as defined in the stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For more information, see Detect unmanaged configuration changes to stacks and resources with drift detection.

nested_items.name: StackResourceDriftStatus
nested_items.description: Status of the resource's actual configuration compared to its expected configuration.
DELETED: The resource differs from its expected configuration in that it has been deleted.
MODIFIED: The resource differs from its expected configuration.

NOT_CHECKED: CloudFormation has not checked if the resource differs from its expected configuration. Any resources that do not currently support drift detection have a status of NOT_CHECKED. For more information, see Resource type support for imports and drift detection.
IN_SYNC: The resource's actual configuration matches its expected configuration.

nested_items.name: LastCheckTimestamp
nested_items.description: When CloudFormation last checked if the resource had drifted from its expected configuration.

nested_items.name: ModuleInfo
nested_items.description: Contains information about the module from which the resource was created, if the resource was created from a module included in the stack template.

nested_items.name: TypeHierarchy
nested_items.description: A concatenated list of the module type or types containing the resource. Module types are listed starting with the inner-most nested module, and separated by /.

nested_items.name: LogicalIdHierarchy
nested_items.description: A concatenated list of the logical IDs of the module or modules containing the resource. Modules are listed starting with the inner-most nested module, and separated by /.
